title: Frontline Villages in Southern Ukraine Endure Shelling Day and Night
description: Small villages along a buffer area between Ukrainian and Russian positions on the Zaporizhzhia front have come under increasingly heavy bombardment.

title: Canada Wildfire Forces Citywide Evacuation of Yellowknife
description: Officials told residents to clear out of the Northwest Territories city of Yellowknife by Friday afternoon. Most were expected to flee south by road.

title: North Koreans Are Starved and Forced to Work, U.N. Hears
description: At a Security Council meeting, officials gave harrowing accounts of rights abuses in North Korea. But global divisions were clear: Russia denounced the discussion, and China questioned its validity.

title: Friday Briefing: The U.S. pulls Japan and South Korea closer
description: Also, questions about new weight loss drugs.

title: Pilot Dies After Medical Emergency on Flight From Miami to Chile
description: The pilot, part of a three-member crew, died after the Latam Airlines flight made an emergency landing in Panama on Monday, the airline said.

title: NATO Chief Clarifies Stance on Possible Ukraine Membership
description: Officials on both sides of the conflict balked at the suggestion that Ukraine should cede territory in order to join the alliance.

title: White House Targets Key Democrats on Potential Saudi-Israel Pact
description: The White House needs to persuade two historic adversaries to find common ground. But then the administration faces a potentially more daunting challenge: getting 67 senators to go along with it.

title: 4 Australians Are Rescued After 36 Hours on Surfboards at Sea
description: The Australians and two members of their boat’s Indonesian crew were found after an extensive search off the coast of North Sumatra, Indonesia. A third crew member is still missing.

title: Women’s Right Activists in Iran Are Detained as Protests Anniversary Nears
description: They stand accused of planning to incite “chaos and vandalism” nearly a year after a young woman’s death in Iranian police custody sparked a mass rebellion.

title: Aleksandar Matanovic, Whose Publishing Company Changed Chess, Dies at 93
description: Largely self-taught, he became a grandmaster in his 20s and was later a founder of Chess Informant, which revolutionized how people studied the game.

title: Renewed Violence in Libya Reflects Power of Militias
description: Violence erupted this week in Libya’s capital, Tripoli, again sowing chaos in a country plagued by instability since the ouster of the dictator Muammar el-Qaddafi more than a decade ago.

title: Israel’s $3.5 Billion Defense Deal With Germany Gets U.S. Approval
description: Israel said that the U.S. government had approved its request to sell Germany a missile defense system, setting in motion a $3.5 billion agreement that Israeli officials described as the country’s “largest ever” weapons deal.

title: Ukraine Says It Will Not Receive F-16 Jets From NATO Allies This Year
description: A spokesman for the Ukrainian Air Force said the advanced planes won’t arrive by winter, meaning they won’t play a role in the latest counteroffensive push.

title: Russia-Ukraine War: First Civilian Ship in a Month Safely Leaves Ukrainian Seaport
description: A civilian cargo ship appears to have safely sailed out of the country’s waters in the Black Sea, the first to do so since Russia threatened all vessels moving to or from Ukraine.

title: Villages on Ukraine’s Front Line Face a Constant Threat of Bombardment
description: Around the village of Kamianske, where only a small number of residents remain, Ukrainian and Russian troops exchange artillery fire day and night.

title: How to Survive in the Heat: Coping Advice From Around the World
description: And other time-tested ways to cope with extreme heat from cultures around the world.

title: Eye on China, Biden Pulls Japan and South Korea Closer
description: The president will host the leaders of the two Asian democracies at Camp David, as Russia’s invasion of Ukraine spurs them to rapidly mend relations.

title: More than 60 Feared Dead After Boat Accident Off Cape Verde
description: The vessel carrying mostly Senegalese nationals was found off the coast of the West African archipelago. Thirty-eight people survived.

title: Hillsong Founder Acquitted of Hiding Sexual Abuse Committed by His Father
description: Brian Houston, who once led Hillsong, was charged because he did not inform the police after his father admitted in 1999 to sexually assaulting a young boy decades before.

title: Canada Wildfire Forces Citywide Evacuation of Yellowknife
description: Officials told residents to clear out of the Northwest Territories city of Yellowknife by Friday afternoon. Most were expected to flee south by road.

title: Thursday Briefing
description: Threats to counterterrorism efforts from the coup in Niger.

title: As Dolphins Die in Black Sea, Ukraine Builds Case for Ecocide Against Russia
description: The animals are dying in droves in the Black Sea, and Ukrainian officials are documenting the deaths, hoping to prosecute Russia for the war’s ecological toll.

title: How Ecuador’s Neighbors Unleashed Drug Violence on Its Soil
description: A presidential candidate’s assassination has focused global attention on the country’s extraordinary bloodshed fueled by powerful international and domestic crime groups.
